alert.note: Alert for Day; Marshall; Roberts (South Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Aberdeen (Northern and Northeastern South Dakota)
info.headline: Blizzard Warning issued January 05 at 1:44AM MST until January 05 at 8:00AM MST by NWS Aberdeen
info.description: ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 AM CST THURSDAY... ...BLIZZARD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 AM CST THIS MORNING... ...WIND CHILL WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 3 AM TO NOON CST THURSDAY... * WHAT...For the Wind Chill Warning, dangerously cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 40 below zero. For the Blizzard Warning, blizzard conditions. Additional snow accumulations of up to one inch. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph. For the Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills. Wind chills as low as 35 below zero. * WHERE...In South Dakota, Marshall, Roberts and Day Counties. In Minnesota, Traverse and Big Stone Counties. * WHEN...For the Wind Chill Warning, from 3 AM to noon CST Thursday. For the Blizzard Warning, until 9 AM CST this morning. For the Wind Chill Advisory, until 3 AM CST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Blowing snow will significantly reduce visibility to one quarter mile or less at times, especially in open and rural areas. The hazardous conditions will impact the morning commute. The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes.
info.instruction: Avoid outside activities if possible. When outside, make sure you wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. Travel should be restricted to emergencies only. If you must travel, have a winter survival kit with you. If you get stranded, stay with your vehicle. Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. In Minnesota, the latest road conditions can be obtained at 511mn.org, or by calling 5 1 1. In South Dakota, the latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
